definition: nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: The editor hacked the story to bits.
sentences.chinese: 编辑把那篇小说改得面目全非。

sentences.english: Another dish was made entirely of organs, which again had been hacked beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 还有一道菜全是内脏，同样砍得面目全非。

sentences.english: All the dead and injured were burned beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 所有的死者和伤者都被烧得面目全非。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the city itself changes almost beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，这个城市本身也变得面目全非。

sentences.english: So now he’s indeed in the hospital, with a swollen, unrecognizable head.
sentences.chinese: 所以现在，他躺在医院里，鼻青脸肿，面目全非。

sentences.english: And he said, "Well, actually we want to be changed unrecognizably.
sentences.chinese: 然后他说，“啊，实际上我们就想被弄得面目全非。

sentences.english: He handed me my composition completely modified .
sentences.chinese: 他把我的作文交还给了我，改得面目全非。

sentences.english: The editor hacked my article to bits.
sentences.chinese: 编辑把我的文章删改得面目全非。

sentences.english: His article has been changed beyond recogniton.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章被改的面目全非。

definition: see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
heavily damaged/(fig.) full of holes/riddled with problems
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
